items.message: River levels remain higher than normal and are currently rising in response to the overnight rainfall. Flooding may affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly low-lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further rainfall is expected later today and tomorrow, and rivers are expected to continue rising. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue further alerts and warnings if required. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water and consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24/11/2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge remain high. No further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses & plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire

items.message: Rising river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 23 November 2025 .  Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Areas most at risk include tributaries between Ringwood and Christchurch but this alerts particular focus is at Moyles Court on the Dockens Water. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Rain has generally moved away from the area but showery rain is forecast for the rest of the day and into the night which may raise levels further. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message: High river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 23 November 2025 .  Flooding may affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the  River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne.  We are closely monitoring the situation .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising following heavy rain this morning which may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 23 November 2025.  Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Frome, Hooke River tributaries between Toller Whelme and Dorchester. Recent rainfall has generally moved away but further scattered showers, sometimes heavy, are forecast over the next 24 hours.  We are closely monitoring the situation .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 November 2025 . 
Areas most at risk include tributaries between Dorchester and Wareham. 
Flooding is possible for at least the next 24 hours as the impact of rain of the previous 24 hours works its way down the River Frome. 
The outlook for the next 48 hours is generally more settled but showery, sometimes heavy rainfall is expected at times in this period. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:30AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and the potential for flooding continues today, 23 November 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  throughout today may lead to flooding.

Flooding is possible today, Sunday 23 November, and for the next few days.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time.

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on Monday 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, especially land around the River Rye and its tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck, Spittle Beck, including properties of Salton, Nunnington and Helmsley. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The River Bure, Spixworth Beck and surrounding Becks
items.message:
High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas between Horsford and Crostwick on the Spixworth Beck, and Corpusty, Saxthorpe, Itteringham, Ingworth, Aylsham and Burgh-next-Aylsham on the Bure. We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. Locations most affected will be land around the River Seven and its tributaries including Northdale Beck, Hartoft Beck, Ings Beck, Lastingham Beck, Sutherland Beck, Cropton Beck, Catter Beck, including properties in Sinnington and to the East of Normanby. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Rising river levels this evening may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 24 November 2025 from 01:00AM. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, local roads and low-lying land around Stamford Bridge, Pocklington, Wressle, Wilberfoss and Elvington.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

items.message: River levels remain high and flooding is possible overnight. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, particularly in the Low Marishes area. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message:
High river levels over the next 24 hours may lead to flooding following recent rainfall.  
Areas most at risk include the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride. Properties at Church Street, Burton Bradstock may need to prepare their pumps with continuing rainfall and rising river levels.  
The heavy rain of the last 24 hours has largely passed but showery, sometimes heavy rain may still affect the area over the next 24 hours.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.  
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  
This message will be updated by 9:30AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 24 November 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:-  Llanymynech 3.0m to 3.3m on 24/11/25 in morning. No flooding expected at other gauge locations currently. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible overnight of 23 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. 
This message will be updated by 10:00am on 24 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 23 November 2025 . 
Areas most at risk are low lying roads and riverside areas on the Deben from Debenham to Ufford, including Framsden, Earl Soham, Easton, Glevering and Wickham Market, and on the Rivers Lark and Finn around Witnesham, Tuddenham St Martin, Playford and Grundisburgh.  We are not expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

items.message:
Rising river levels this evening may lead to flooding.

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Particularly at the foot bridge north of Becks Isle, Wells walk and Bridge Street. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .
